info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 08 at 3:13AM MST until January 09 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches, with locally up to 12 inches across the mesas along the CO border. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph. * WHERE...Far Northeast Highlands, Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass, and Union County. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Some roads may be closed. Significant travel delays are possible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Very strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snowfall and strongest winds are expected during the day Monday. Areas of blowing snow may continue through Monday night after snowfall ends. Snow drifts up to several feet are expected.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.
